trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Igloo Software | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Igloo Software | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Igloo Software with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Igloo Software with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Igloo Software.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Igloo Software.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An <linkText>Igloo Software</linkText><title></title> Single sign on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An <linkText>Igloo Software</linkText><title></title> Single sign on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Igloo Software will be able to single sign into the application at your Igloo Software company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Igloo Software will be able to single sign into the application at your Igloo Software company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Igloo Software
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Igloo Software

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Igloo Software.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Igloo Software.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Igloo Software.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Igloo Software.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Igloo Software, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Igloo Software, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Igloo</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Igloo</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Igloo Software with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Igloo Software with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Central Desktop tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Central Desktop tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Igloo Software application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Igloo Software application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Igloo Software page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Igloo Software page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Igloo Software Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.igloocommunities.com/?signin", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Igloo Software Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.igloocommunities.com/?signin", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Igloo Software page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Igloo Software page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Igloo Software company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Igloo Software company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Control Panel.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Control Panel.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Control Panel</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Control Panel</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Membership tab, click Sign In Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the Membership tab, click Sign In Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sign in Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sign in Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML Configuration section, click Configure SAML Authentication.
trans-unit.target: In the SAML Configuration section, click Configure SAML Authentication.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the General Configuration section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the General Configuration section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>General Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>General Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Connection Name textbox, type a custom name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the Connection Name textbox, type a custom name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Igloo Software dialogue page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Igloo Software dialogue page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Igloo Software dialogue page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Igloo Software dialogue page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: As Logout Response and Request HTTP Type, select POST.
trans-unit.target: As Logout Response and Request HTTP Type, select POST.

trans-unit.source: Create a text file from the downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a text file from the downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Remove the first line () and the last line () from the text file version of your certificate, copy the remaining certificate text, and then paste it into the Public Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Remove the first line () and the last line () from the text file version of your certificate, copy the remaining certificate text, and then paste it into the Public Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Response and Authentication Configuration, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Response and Authentication Configuration, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Response and Authentication Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Response and Authentication Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As Identity Provider, select Microsoft ADFS.
trans-unit.target: As Identity Provider, select Microsoft ADFS.

trans-unit.source: As Identifier Type, select Email Address.
trans-unit.target: As Identifier Type, select Email Address.

trans-unit.source: In the Email Attribute textbox, type emailaddress.
trans-unit.target: In the Email Attribute textbox, type emailaddress.

trans-unit.source: In the First Name Attribute textbox, type givenname.
trans-unit.target: In the First Name Attribute textbox, type givenname.

trans-unit.source: In the Last Name Attribute textbox, type surname.
trans-unit.target: In the Last Name Attribute textbox, type surname.

trans-unit.source: Preform the following steps to complete the configuration:
trans-unit.target: Preform the following steps to complete the configuration:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>User creation on Sign in</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>User creation on Sign in</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As User creation on Sign in, select Create a new user in your site when they sign in.
trans-unit.target: As User creation on Sign in, select Create a new user in your site when they sign in.

trans-unit.source: As Sign in Settings, select Use SAML button on “Sign in” screen.
trans-unit.target: As Sign in Settings, select Use SAML button on “Sign in” screen.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Igloo Software.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Igloo Software.

trans-unit.source: When an assigned user tries to log into Igloo Software using the access panel, Igloo Software checks whether the user exists.
trans-unit.target: When an assigned user tries to log into Igloo Software using the access panel, Igloo Software checks whether the user exists.

trans-unit.source: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Igloo Software.
trans-unit.target: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Igloo Software.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Igloo Software **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Igloo Software **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
